titleStmt.title: The speech without doores defended without reason. Or, A vindication of the Parliaments honour: in a rejoynder to three pamphlets published in defence of M. Chaloners speech.
titleStmt.author: Birkenhead, John, Sir, 1616-1679.

titleStmt.title: The speech without doores defended without reason. Or, A vindication of the Parliaments honour: in a rejoynder to three pamphlets published in defence of M. Chaloners speech.
titleStmt.author: Birkenhead, John, Sir, 1616-1679.

notesStmt.note: A reply by John Birkenhead to "The justification of a safe and wel-grounded answer to the Scottish papers, printed under the name of Master Chaloner his speech", "An answer to severall objections made against some things in Mr. Thomas Chaloners speech", and "A reply to a namelesse pamphlet, intituled, An answer to a speech without doors, &c. Or, a defence of Master Chaloner's speech", in defence of Birkenheads: An answer to a speech without doores.
Publication date from colophon, place of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
